intro: Cacalia lilacina, commonly known as the lilac morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy flowers. The plant produces trumpet-shaped blooms that range in color from pink to deep purple, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Cacalia lilacina thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
